  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    AttributeReadAccessKey, AttributeReadAltText, AttributeReadAttribute, AttributeReadCollapsed, AttributeReadColumnSpan, AttributeReadEnabled, AttributeReadFocused, AttributeReadHeightInRows, AttributeReadHtmlId, AttributeReadImage<UiWidgetImage>, AttributeReadLabel, AttributeReadLengthProperty, AttributeReadMaximumTextLength, AttributeReadPrimaryStyle, AttributeReadResizable, AttributeReadSelectionMode, AttributeReadSizeInPixel, AttributeReadStyles, AttributeReadStylesAdvanced, AttributeReadTooltip, AttributeReadUrl, AttributeReadValidationFailure, AttributeWriteAccessKey, AttributeWriteAttribute, AttributeWriteCollapsed, AttributeWriteEnabled, AttributeWriteFocused, AttributeWriteHtmlId, AttributeWriteImage<UiWidgetImage>, AttributeWriteLabel, AttributeWriteLengthProperty, AttributeWriteOnlyAttribute, AttributeWriteOnlyFocused, AttributeWritePrimaryStyle, AttributeWriteStyles, AttributeWriteStylesAdvanced, AttributeWriteTooltip, UiWidgetAdapter, UiWidgetAdapterActive, UiWidgetAdapterComposite<UiWidgetRegular>, UiWidgetAdapterSingleComposite<UiWidgetRegular>, UiWidgetAdapterSingleMutableComposite<UiWidgetRegular>, UiWidgetAdapterWithLabel, UiWidgetAdapterAbstractBorderPanel, UiWidgetAdapterBorderPanel, UiWidgetAdapterCollapsableBorderPanel, CollapseExpandButton.CollapseHandler, HandlerRegistrationCollector, AttributeReadDisposed, AttributeReadId<String>, AttributeReadTitle<String>, AttributeWriteDisposed, AttributeWriteId<String>, Accessibility

    public class UiWidgetAdapterGwtCollapsableBorderPanel
extends UiWidgetAdapterGwtBorderPanel
implements UiWidgetAdapterCollapsableBorderPanel, CollapseExpandButton.CollapseHandler
    This is the implementation of UiWidgetAdapterCollapsableBorderPanel using GWT based on Fieldset and CollapseExpandButton.
    Since:
    1.0.0
    Author:
    Joerg Hohwiller (hohwille at users.sourceforge.net)

    • Method Detail

      • setEnabled

        public void setEnabled(boolean enabled)
        This method sets the enabled status of this object. If it is disabled, the user can not interact with the object.
        Specified by:
        setEnabled in interface AttributeWriteEnabled
        Overrides:
        setEnabled in class UiWidgetAdapterGwtBorderPanel
        Parameters:
        enabled - - if true the object will be enabled, else the object will be disabled.

      • setFocused

        public boolean setFocused()
        This method sets the focus to this object.
        NOTE:
        You can only set the focus. To actually remove it, you need to set it in a different widget. Further, as an API user you can normally ignore the result. This is only relevant for composite widgets such as panels, that delegate the call recursively and may not contain any child that can take the focus.
        Specified by:
        setFocused in interface AttributeWriteOnlyFocused
        Returns:
        true if the focus has been set successfully, false otherwise.

      • isCollapsed

        public boolean isCollapsed()
        This method determines if this object is collapsed. This means that some content is hidden (folded away). If it is NOT collapsed, it is called expanded and the content gets visible again.
        Specified by:
        isCollapsed in interface AttributeReadCollapsed
        Returns:
        true if this object is collapsed, false if expanded.

      • setCollapsed

        public void setCollapsed(boolean collapsed)
        This method sets the collapsed status of this object.
        Specified by:
        setCollapsed in interface AttributeWriteCollapsed
        Parameters:
        collapsed - - if true the object will be collapsed, else it will be expanded.

      • setAccessKey

        public void setAccessKey(char accessKey)
        This method sets the accessKey attribute of this object.
        Specified by:
        setAccessKey in interface AttributeWriteAccessKey
        Parameters:
        accessKey - is the new value of AttributeReadAccessKey.getAccessKey(). Use AttributeReadAccessKey.ACCESS_KEY_NONE to unset.

      • onCollapse

        public void onCollapse(boolean collapse,
                       boolean programmatic)
        This method is called to notify about collapsing and expanding. It has to implement the logic that actually shows and hides things accordingly.
        Specified by:
        onCollapse in interface CollapseExpandButton.CollapseHandler
        Parameters:
        collapse - - true if switched to collapsed state, false if switched to expanded state.
        programmatic - - see UiEvent.isProgrammatic().
